intro: Hieracium tortisquameum, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are rough to the touch and have a distinctive hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium tortisquameum is often found in disturbed habitats and can sometimes be invasive in certain regions.
